intro: Pennellia gracilis, commonly known as the slender pennellia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas with rich soil. Pennellia gracilis has smooth, alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface. It is a relatively small plant, reaching heights of only a few inches, making it a delicate addition to native plant gardens.
